thread.title: Goa and Punjab Assembly Elections 2017: Record turnout of 83% voters in Goa, Punjab witnesses 70%, says EC
thread.title_full: Goa and Punjab Assembly Elections 2017: Record turnout of 83% voters in Goa, Punjab witnesses 70%, says EC

author: FE Online
title: Goa and Punjab Assembly Elections 2017: Record turnout of 83% voters in Goa, Punjab witnesses 70%, says EC
text:
Elections 2017 Goa and Punjab Assembly Elections 2017: Record turnout of 83% voters in Goa, Punjab witnesses 70%, says EC Goa and Punjab Assembly Elections 2017: Record turnout of 83% voters in Goa, Punjab witnesses 70%, says EC Briefing the poll updates to the media, Deputy Election Commissioner Umesh Sinha said that there had been a record turnout of 83% voters in Goa. While the voter turnout of Punjab was tentatively 70% until 5 pm. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 4, 2017 7:47 PM The EC also said that 100% use of electronically transmitted postal ballot system had been done in Goa for the first time. (PTI) 
Post assembly elections in Goa and Punjab, the Election Commission has today declared that 100% webcasting has been done at all polling stations in Goa. Briefing the poll updates to the media, Deputy Election Commissioner Umesh Sinha said that there had been a record turnout of 83% voters in Goa. While the voter turnout of Punjab was tentatively 70% until 5 pm. 
The Electioction Commission has further stated the cash worth Rs 58.02 crore, 12.43 lakh litres liquor worth Rs 13.34 crore, 2598 Kgs of drugs and narcotics worth Rs 18.26 crore had been seized from Punjab. The EC also said that 100% use of electronically transmitted postal ballot system had been done in Goa for the first time. In Goa, there was one polling station managed totally by the persons with disability.
